3: Heh. Guess it was worth tryna get near the surface.
I'm now in... I don't even know where I am.
I think I have a hatch to the surface here before me, but it ain't budging from my end.
I just pulled the building standard reference of Venus Splash Park from the Ferris wheel terminal. I've roughly figured out the design system this whole place runs on.
According to the reference, the hatches in this area are all installed on the ground end of the rotating mechanism. They have pyrotechnic fasteners for emergency activation.
This kinda run-of-the-mill control system should a cakewalk for you to crack, yeah?
Alright then! Access the network through the signature code I just sent you, and hack into the control system...
Yo, that's pretty quick! Nice job, Lee!
Okay, now we'll just have to input a manual overload command here...
You hear alarm bells ring in the park, followed by a dull explosion.
The hatch should be blown open. What's left is... to hope that we blew open the right one.
